meanings.definition: A person who is the legal property of another and is forced to obey them.
meanings.sent1: In the past, some people were treated as slaves and had to do whatever their owners commanded.
meanings.sent2: The slaves worked in the fields from sunrise to sunset under the scorching sun.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a robot vacuum cleaner having tiny slaves inside to clean the house is quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The heavy chains of addiction turned him into a slave to his vices.
meanings.sent5: The image of the slaves rowing the ship with synchronized movements was hauntingly beautiful.

meanings.sent1: She slaves away at her desk every day to meet her deadlines.
meanings.sent2: The chef slaves in the kitchen for hours to prepare the perfect meal for his customers.
meanings.sent3: The little ant slaves tirelessly to gather food for the winter ahead.
meanings.sent4: He slaves over his homework late into the night to ensure he gets good grades.
meanings.sent5: The determined athlete slaves in the gym to improve his performance on the field.
